017package org.apache.juneau.bean.html5;
018
019import static org.apache.juneau.html.annotation.HtmlFormat.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
021import static org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.XmlFormat.*;
022
023import java.net.*;
024
025import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.html.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
030import org.apache.juneau.xml.annotation.*;
031
032/**
033 * Superclass for all HTML elements.
034 *
035 * <p>
036 * These are beans that when serialized using {@link HtmlSerializer} generate valid HTML5 elements.
037 *
038 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
039 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanHtml5">juneau-bean-html5</a>
040
041 * </ul>
042 */
043@org.apache.juneau.html.annotation.Html(format=XML)
044@FluentSetters
045public abstract class HtmlElement {
046
047   private java.util.Map<String,Object> attrs;
048
049   /**
050    * The attributes of this element.
051    *
052    * @return The attributes of this element.
053    */
054   @Xml(format=ATTRS)
055   @Beanp("a")
056   public java.util.Map<String,Object> getAttrs() {
057      return attrs;
058   }
059
060   /**
061    * Sets the attributes for this element.
062    *
063    * @param attrs The new attributes for this element.
064    * @return This object.
065    */
066   @Beanp("a")
067   public HtmlElement setAttrs(java.util.Map<String,Object> attrs) {
068      if (attrs != null) {
069         attrs.entrySet().forEach(x -> {
070            var key = x.getKey();
071            if ("url".equals(key) || "href".equals(key) || key.endsWith("action"))
072               x.setValue(StringUtils.toURI(x.getValue()));
073         });
074      }
075      this.attrs = attrs;
076      return this;
077   }
078
079   /**
080    * Adds an arbitrary attribute to this element.
081    *
082    * @param key The attribute name.
083    * @param val The attribute value.
084    * @return This object.
085    */
086   public HtmlElement attr(String key, Object val) {
087      if (attrs == null)
088         attrs = map();
089      if (val == null)
090         attrs.remove(key);
091      else {
092         if ("url".equals(key) || "href".equals(key) || key.endsWith("action"))
093            val = StringUtils.toURI(val);
094         attrs.put(key, val);
095      }
096      return this;
097   }
098
099   /**
100    * Adds an arbitrary URI attribute to this element.
101    *
102    * <p>
103    * Same as {@link #attr(String, Object)}, except if the value is a string that appears to be a URI
104    * (e.g. <js>"servlet:/xxx"</js>).
105    *
106    * <p>
107    * The value can be of any of the following types: {@link URI}, {@link URL}, {@link String}.
108    * Strings must be valid URIs.
109    *
110    * <p>
111    * URIs defined by {@link UriResolver} can be used for values.
112    *
113    * @param key The attribute name.
114    * @param val The attribute value.
115    * @return This object.
116    */
117   public HtmlElement attrUri(String key, Object val) {
118      if (attrs == null)
119         attrs = map();
120      attrs.put(key, StringUtils.toURI(val));
121      return this;
122   }
123
124   /**
125    * Returns the attribute with the specified name.
126    *
127    * @param key The attribute name.
128    * @return The attribute value, or <jk>null</jk> if the named attribute does not exist.
129    */
130   public String getAttr(String key) {
131      return getAttr(String.class, key);
132   }
133
134   /**
135    * Returns the attribute with the specified name converted to the specified class type.
136    *
137    * @param <T> The class type to convert this class to.
138    * @param type
139    *    The class type to convert this class to.
140    *    See {@link ConverterUtils} for a list of supported conversion types.
141    * @param key The attribute name.
142    * @return The attribute value, or <jk>null</jk> if the named attribute does not exist.
143    */
144   public <T> T getAttr(Class<T> type, String key) {
145      return attrs == null ? null : ConverterUtils.toType(attrs.get(key), type);
146   }
147
148   /**
149    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/editing.html#the-accesskey-attribute">accesskey</a>
150    * attribute.
151    *
152    * <p>
153    * Defines a keyboard shortcut to activate or focus an element.
154    * The value should be a single character that, when pressed with a modifier key (usually Alt),
155    * activates the element.
156    *
157    * @param accesskey The keyboard shortcut character (e.g., <js>"a"</js>, <js>"1"</js>).
158    * @return This object.
159    */
160   @FluentSetter
161   public HtmlElement accesskey(String value) {
162      attr("accesskey", value);
163      return this;
164   }
165
166   /**
167    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#classes">class</a> attribute.
168    *
169    * <p>
170    * Specifies one or more CSS class names for the element, separated by spaces.
171    * These classes can be used for styling and JavaScript selection.
172    *
173    * @param _class Space-separated CSS class names (e.g., <js>"btn btn-primary"</js>).
174    * @return This object.
175    */
176   @FluentSetter
177   public HtmlElement _class(String value) {  // NOSONAR - Intentional naming.
178      attr("class", value);
179      return this;
180   }
181
182   /**
183    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/editing.html#attr-contenteditable">contenteditable</a>
184    * attribute.
185    *
186    * <p>
187    * Indicates whether the element's content is editable by the user.
188    *
189    * <p>
190    * Possible values:
191    * <ul>
192    *    <li><js>"true"</js> or empty string - Element content is editable</li>
193    *    <li><js>"false"</js> - Element content is not editable</li>
194    *    <li><js>"plaintext-only"</js> - Element content is editable, but rich text formatting is disabled</li>
195    * </ul>
196    *
197    * @param contenteditable The editability state of the element.
198    * @return This object.
199    */
200   @FluentSetter
201   public HtmlElement contenteditable(Object value) {
202      attr("contenteditable", value);
203      return this;
204   }
205
206   /**
207    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#the-dir-attribute">dir</a> attribute.
208    *
209    * <p>
210    * Specifies the text direction of the element's content.
211    *
212    * <p>
213    * Possible values:
214    * <ul>
215    *    <li><js>"ltr"</js> - Left-to-right text direction</li>
216    *    <li><js>"rtl"</js> - Right-to-left text direction</li>
217    *    <li><js>"auto"</js> - Browser determines direction based on content</li>
218    * </ul>
219    *
220    * @param dir The text direction for the element.
221    * @return This object.
222    */
223   @FluentSetter
224   public HtmlElement dir(String value) {
225      attr("dir", value);
226      return this;
227   }
228
229   /**
230    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/editing.html#the-hidden-attribute">hidden</a> attribute.
231    *
232    * <p>
233    * This attribute uses deminimized values:
234    * <ul>
235    *    <li><jk>false</jk> - Attribute is not added</li>
236    *    <li><jk>true</jk> - Attribute is added as <js>"hidden"</js></li>
237    *    <li>Other values - Passed through as-is</li>
238    * </ul>
239    *
240    * @param hidden
241    *    The new value for this attribute.
242    *    Typically a {@link Boolean} or {@link String}.
243    * @return This object.
244    */
245   @FluentSetter
246   public HtmlElement hidden(Object value) {
247      attr("hidden", deminimize(value, "hidden"));
248      return this;
249   }
250
251   /**
252    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#the-id-attribute">id</a> attribute.
253    *
254    * <p>
255    * Specifies a unique identifier for the element. The ID must be unique within the document
256    * and can be used for CSS styling, JavaScript selection, and anchor links.
257    *
258    * @param id A unique identifier for the element (e.g., <js>"header"</js>, <js>"main-content"</js>).
259    * @return This object.
260    */
261   @FluentSetter
262   public HtmlElement id(String value) {
263      attr("id", value);
264      return this;
265   }
266
267   /**
268    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#attr-lang">lang</a> attribute.
269    *
270    * <p>
271    * Specifies the primary language of the element's content using a language tag.
272    * This helps with accessibility, search engines, and browser features like spell checking.
273    *
274    * @param lang A language tag (e.g., <js>"en"</js>, <js>"en-US"</js>, <js>"es"</js>, <js>"fr-CA"</js>).
275    * @return This object.
276    */
277   @FluentSetter
278   public HtmlElement lang(String value) {
279      attr("lang", value);
280      return this;
281   }
282
283   /**
284    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-onabort">onabort</a> attribute.
285    *
286    * <p>
287    * Event handler for when an operation is aborted (e.g., image loading is cancelled).
288    *
289    * @param onabort JavaScript code to execute when the abort event occurs.
290    * @return This object.
291    */
292   @FluentSetter
293   public HtmlElement onabort(String value) {
294      attr("onabort", value);
295      return this;
296   }
297
298   /**
299    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-onblur">onblur</a> attribute.
300    *
301    * <p>
302    * Event handler for when the element loses focus.
303    *
304    * <h5 class='section'>Note:</h5>
305    * <p>
306    * If your HTML serializer is configured to use single quotes for attribute values, you should use double quotes
307    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
308    * For example:
309    * <ul>
310    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onblur(<js>"validate(\"email\")"</js>)</c>
311    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onblur(<js>"validate('email')"</js>)</c>
312    * </ul>
313    *
314    * @param onblur JavaScript code to execute when the element loses focus.
315    * @return This object.
316    */
317   @FluentSetter
318   public HtmlElement onblur(String value) {
319      attr("onblur", value);
320      return this;
321   }
322
323   /**
324    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-oncancel">oncancel</a> attribute.
325    *
326    * <p>
327    * Event handler for when a dialog is cancelled.
328    *
329    * @param oncancel JavaScript code to execute when the cancel event occurs.
330    * @return This object.
331    */
332   @FluentSetter
333   public HtmlElement oncancel(String value) {
334      attr("oncancel", value);
335      return this;
336   }
337
338   /**
339    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-oncanplay">oncanplay</a> attribute.
340    *
341    * <p>
342    * Event handler for when the media can start playing (enough data has been buffered).
343    *
344    * @param oncanplay JavaScript code to execute when the canplay event occurs.
345    * @return This object.
346    */
347   @FluentSetter
348   public HtmlElement oncanplay(String value) {
349      attr("oncanplay", value);
350      return this;
351   }
352
353   /**
354    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-oncanplaythrough">oncanplaythrough</a>
355    * attribute.
356    *
357    * <p>
358    * Event handler for when the media can play through to the end without buffering.
359    *
360    * @param oncanplaythrough JavaScript code to execute when the canplaythrough event occurs.
361    * @return This object.
362    */
363   @FluentSetter
364   public HtmlElement oncanplaythrough(String value) {
365      attr("oncanplaythrough", value);
366      return this;
367   }
368
369   /**
370    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-onchange">onchange</a> attribute.
371    *
372    * <p>
373    * Event handler for when the value of a form element changes and loses focus.
374    *
375    * <h5 class='section'>Note:</h5>
376    * <p>
377    * If your HTML serializer is configured to use single quotes for attribute values, you should use double quotes
378    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
379    * For example:
380    * <ul>
381    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onchange(<js>"validate(\"field\")"</js>)</c>
382    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onchange(<js>"validate('field')"</js>)</c>
383    * </ul>
384    *
385    * @param onchange JavaScript code to execute when the change event occurs.
386    * @return This object.
387    */
388   @FluentSetter
389   public HtmlElement onchange(String value) {
390      attr("onchange", value);
391      return this;
392   }
393
394   /**
395    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-onclick">onclick</a> attribute.
396    *
397    * <p>
398    * Event handler for when the element is clicked.
399    *
400    * <h5 class='section'>Note:</h5>
401    * <p>
402    * If your HTML serializer is configured to use single quotes for attribute values, you should use double quotes
403    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
404    * For example:
405    * <ul>
406    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onclick(<js>"alert(\"Hello\")"</js>)</c>
407    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onclick(<js>"alert('Hello')"</js>)</c>
408    * </ul>
409    *
410    * @param onclick JavaScript code to execute when the click event occurs.
411    * @return This object.
412    */
413   @FluentSetter
414   public HtmlElement onclick(String value) {
415      attr("onclick", value);
416      return this;
417   }
418
419   /**

513    *
514    * <p>
515    * Event handler for when the element receives focus.
516    *
517    * <h5 class='section'>Note:</h5>
518    * <p>
519    * If your HTML serializer is configured to use single quotes for attribute values, you should use double quotes
520    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
521    * For example:
522    * <ul>
523    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onfocus(<js>"highlight(\"field\")"</js>)</c>
524    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onfocus(<js>"highlight('field')"</js>)</c>
525    * </ul>
526    *
527    * @param onfocus JavaScript code to execute when the focus event occurs.
528    * @return This object.
529    */
530   @FluentSetter
531   public HtmlElement onfocus(String value) {
532      attr("onfocus", value);
533      return this;
534   }

539    * <p>
540    * Event handler for when the value of an input element changes (fires on every keystroke).
541    *
542    * @param oninput JavaScript code to execute when the input event occurs.
543    * @return This object.
544    */
545   @FluentSetter
546   public HtmlElement oninput(String value) {

548      return this;

560   @FluentSetter

620    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
621    * For example:
622    * <ul>
623    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onload(<js>"init(\"config\")"</js>)</c>
624    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onload(<js>"init('config')"</js>)</c>
625    * </ul>
626    *

628    * @return This object.
629    */

668   /**
669    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/webappapis.html#handler-onloadstart">onloadstart</a>
670    * attribute.
671    *
672    * <p>
673    * Event handler for when the browser starts loading the media.
674    *
675    * @param onloadstart JavaScript code to execute when the loadstart event occurs.
676    * @return This object.
677    */
678   @FluentSetter
679   public HtmlElement onloadstart(String value) {
680      attr("onloadstart", value);
681      return this;
682   }

765    *
766    * <p>
767    * Event handler for when the mouse pointer moves over the element (bubbles).
768    *
769    * <h5 class='section'>Note:</h5>
770    * <p>
771    * If your HTML serializer is configured to use single quotes for attribute values, you should use double quotes
772    * in your JavaScript code, and vice versa. Otherwise, the quotes will be converted to HTML entities.
773    * For example:
774    * <ul>
775    *    <li>If using single quotes for attributes: <c>onmouseover(<js>"showTooltip(\"info\")"</js>)</c>
776    *    <li>If using double quotes for attributes: <c>onmouseover(<js>"showTooltip('info')"</js>)</c>
777    * </ul>
778    *
779    * @param onmouseover JavaScript code to execute when the mouseover event occurs.
780    * @return This object.
781    */
782   @FluentSetter
783   public HtmlElement onmouseover(String value) {
784      attr("onmouseover", value);
785      return this;
786   }

1157    *
1158    * <p>
1159    * Specifies the tab order of the element when navigating with the keyboard.
1160    *
1161    * <p>
1162    * Possible values:
1163    * <ul>
1164    *    <li>Positive integer - Element is focusable and participates in tab order</li>
1165    *    <li><js>"0"</js> - Element is focusable but not in tab order</li>
1166    *    <li>Negative integer - Element is not focusable</li>
1167    * </ul>
1168    *
1169    * @param tabindex The tab order value for keyboard navigation.
1170    * @return This object.
1171    */
1172   @FluentSetter
1173   public HtmlElement tabindex(Object value) {
1174      attr("tabindex", value);
1175      return this;
1176   }

1194   /**
1195    * <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/TR/html5/dom.html#attr-translate">translate</a> attribute.
1196    *
1197    * <p>
1198    * Specifies whether the element's content should be translated when the page is localized.
1199    *
1200    * <p>
1201    * Possible values:
1202    * <ul>
1203    *    <li><js>"yes"</js> - Content should be translated (default)</li>
1204    *    <li><js>"no"</js> - Content should not be translated</li>
1205    * </ul>
1206    *
1207    * @param translate Whether the element content should be translated.
1208    * @return This object.
1209    */
1210   @FluentSetter
1211   public HtmlElement translate(Object value) {
1212      attr("translate", value);
1213      return this;
1214   }
1215
1216   /**
1217    * If the specified attribute is a boolean, it gets converted to the attribute name if <jk>true</jk> or <jk>null</jk> if <jk>false</jk>.
1218    *
1219    * @param value The attribute value.
1220    * @param attr The attribute name.
1221    * @return The deminimized value, or the same value if the value wasn't a boolean.
1222    */
1223   protected Object deminimize(Object value, String attr) {
1224      if (value instanceof Boolean b) {
1225         if (Boolean.TRUE.equals(b))
1226            return attr;
1227         return null;
1228      }
1229      return value;
1230   }
1231
1232   // <FluentSetters>
1233
1234   // </FluentSetters>
1235
1236   @Override /* Object */
1237   public String toString() {
1238      return HtmlSerializer.DEFAULT_SIMPLE_SQ.toString(this);
1239   }
1240}
